boat.construction_details: Mould taken from a Victorian Gentleman's yacht

for_sales.sales_text: Beautiful fast gaff cutter, one of only two built in GRP from a mould taken from a Victorian gentleman"s yacht. 30" on deck plus 6" bowsprit. Beam 8’2". Draft 4’7". Deep keel. Solid spruce mast, boom and gaff. Stainless steel standing rigging. Cabin fitted out for cruising, with standing room, one double and two single berths, two-ring cooker, sink, heads etc. Yanmar 1GM10 engine. Two 12V batteries. Stainless steel tanks. Two independent Garmin GPS systems, depth sounder, log, electronic masthead anemometer/wind angle indicator, DSC VHF. Autohelm. Plastimo inflatable dinghy. Recent survey available.

boat.full_description:
Chickpea is one of two yachts built in GRP from a mould taken from the Victorian gentleman's cutter Fortuna. Both were built as open day-sailing yachts.

Her sister ship, Katie, is still sailed as an open boat but Chickpea was later fitted for cruising with a cabin.
boat.name: Chickpea
boat.short_description: 'Chickpea' is a 30' (LOD) gaff-rigged cutter, built 1990, with hull and deck in GRP. The plug was an original Victorian gentleman's cutter, 'Fortuna' (circa 1880).
